member.name: M:AspectSharp.Builder.AspectLanguageEngineBuilder.#ctor
member.summary: Should be used cautiously by subclasses.

member.name: M:AspectSharp.Builder.XmlEngineBuilder.#ctor
member.summary: Should be used cautiously by subclasses.

member.name: T:AspectSharp.Core.IMutableMethodInvocation
member.summary: Extends the original behavior by adding the ability to change the method arguments for the next executions

member.name: T:AspectSharp.Core.CustomProxyGenerator
member.summary: Generates a dynamic proxy. This overrides the .Net proxy requirements that forces one to extend MarshalByRefObject or (for a different purpose) ContextBoundObject to have a Proxiable class.

member.name: M:AspectSharp.Core.CustomProxyGenerator.CreateProxy(System.Type,System.Object,System.Object[],Castle.DynamicProxy.IInterceptor)
member.summary: Generates a proxy implementing the specified interface and the mixins redirecting method invocations to the specifed interceptor.
member.param: Array of instances (mixins) to be introducted.

member.name: M:AspectSharp.Core.CustomProxyGenerator.CreateClassProxy(System.Type,System.Object[],Castle.DynamicProxy.IInterceptor,System.Object[])
member.summary: Generates a class which extends the baseClass, overriding all the virtual methods and implementing all the mixin interfaces.
member.param: Array of mixins to be implemented by the proxy

member.name: M:AspectSharp.Core.CustomProxyGenerator.CreateGeneratorContext(System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a context - which is used to guid custom proxy generation.
member.param: Array of mixins to be registered

member.name: T:AspectSharp.Core.Proxy.DefaultProxyFactory
member.summary: Default implementation of IProxyFactory which uses Castle.DynamicProxy to generate the proxies.

member.name: T:AspectSharp.Core.IProxyFactory
member.summary: Defines the contract used by AspectEngine to obtain proxies.
member.remarks: The generated type must obey the requirements of Aspect#, in other words, the definitions in the AspectDefinition must be proper handled.

member.name: M:AspectSharp.Core.IProxyFactory.CreateInterfaceProxy(System.Type,System.Object,AspectSharp.Lang.AST.AspectDefinition)
member.summary: Implementors must return a proxy (concrete class) that implements the specified interface and dispatch the call to the specified target.

member.name: M:AspectSharp.Core.IProxyFactory.CreateClassProxy(System.Type,AspectSharp.Lang.AST.AspectDefinition,System.Object[])
member.summary: Implementors must return a proxy (concrete class) that extends the specified classType.

member.name: F:AspectSharp.Core.Proxy.DefaultProxyFactory._aspect2ProxyType
member.summary: For caching, we associate the AspectDefinition with a dynamic Type to avoid regenerate it.

member.name: T:AspectSharp.Core.Proxy.DefaultProxyFactory.AspectInstanceKey
member.summary: Key to identify cached aspect type instances

member.name: T:AspectSharp.AspectEngine
member.summary: The AspectEngine is responsible for matching specified types agaisnt an AspectDefinition. If a match is found, a proxy is requested and the AOP features will be implemented in the Proxy.

member.name: M:AspectSharp.AspectEngine.#ctor(AspectSharp.Lang.AST.EngineConfiguration)
member.param: From where to gather the configuration

member.name: M:AspectSharp.AspectEngine.Wrap(System.Object)
member.summary: Wraps an object. The object specified is no longer used hence this method is marked as obsolete.
member.remarks: We cannot stress enough that the instance passed must not be used to access the object contents.

member.name: M:AspectSharp.AspectEngine.WrapClass(System.Type,System.Object[])
member.summary: Wraps an interface. The target argument must be an object capable of responding to the interface messages, or your interceptors must be capable of respoding to them.
member.param: Concrete class with a available constructor (public or protected) to be wrapped

member.name: M:AspectSharp.AspectEngine.WrapInterface(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Wraps an interface. The target argument must be an object capable of responding to the interface messages, or your interceptors must be capable of respoding to them.
member.param: The object that responds to the interface messages

member.name: M:AspectSharp.AspectEngine.Union(AspectSharp.Lang.AST.AspectDefinition[])
member.summary: Creates a single AspectDefinition as the merge of two or more AspectDefinitions

member.name: P:AspectSharp.AspectEngine.Configuration
member.summary: The configuration applied to this AspectEngine instance

member.name: P:AspectSharp.AspectEngine.ProxyFactory
member.summary: The implementation responsible for generating the proxies.

member.name: P:AspectSharp.AspectEngine.AspectMatcher
member.summary: The implementation responsible for matching the types against the AspectDefinitions in the configuration.
